result.execSummary:
The defendant Spencer C Grant was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS Eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Programs. Sentence credit of 13 days were granted if imposed.
Concurrent with: Case 15CF665

miscConds.notes: Cash bail applied to costs, balance to be refunded to poster.  Court waives the DNA Surcharge on this case.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered. Inform agent of all prescriptions.
Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.

Cases 14CM2304, 14CM2305, 15CM1615 and 15CF1103 were dismissed and read in. No Contact with William or Kyle Lewis and Mitchell Shepherd. Provide DNA specimen unless previously obtained. Surcharge is imposed. 
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (ie, bars, taverns, or liquor stores).
  No association with any known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed.
Maintain employment and/or school combination. 
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Spencer C Grant in court with attorney Jorge R Fragoso.

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty count 1.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of count 1.
Count 2 is dismissed as a read in.



Court orders the following:
Total Prison:  3.5 Years.
Initial Confinement:  1.5 Years.
Extended Supervision:  2 Years.
13 Days Credit.
Concurrent to case:  15CF665
STAYED.

IF REVOKED:
Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Term of Probation:  3 Years.
Concurrent to case:  15CF665
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
Criminal Thinking Class and follow through if agent deems appropriate.
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No Contact with:  William or Kyle Lewis and Mitchell Shepherd.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).

Costs:  $268
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  Court Waives.
Apply bail and refund balance to the posting party.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.    

Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 18, 2016 at 10:30 am.

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Kelly Pingel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Spencer C Grant in court with attorney Jorge R Fragoso.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 18, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 03-11-2016 10:00 am
signed and filed.

Judicial transfer done pursuant to Chief Judge Order 11-SO-03(67) effective May 1, 2011 related to the assignment of new cases to the judge responsible for any cases currently pending for a defendant.  Cases 'currently' pending include post-judgment matters awaiting sentencing after revocation, modification of sentence, or any other action by a judge.


Request for Judicial Transfer signed and filed.

Attorney Smith advises the Court the Defendant is currently involved in treatment but is looking into additional treatment.  Attorney Smith requests a date after 1/20/16  Hearing scheduled for January 22, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant to reside with his Mother and comply with household rules.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant Spencer C Grant in court, in custody, with attorney Joseph Smith.   Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.   Attorney Smith requests a modification of bail.  No objection from the State.   The Court granted the Motion to Modify Bail.  Hearing scheduled for December 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Motion to Modify Bail received from Attorney Smith.
